pullRequest.body:
- Add `Integrable.of_isEmpty`.
- Add `integral_of_isEmpty`.


---

if it passes the continuous integration checks.

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

</details>

#### Declarations diff

`+ Integrable.of_isEmpty`
`+ integral_of_isEmpty`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
```

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
Please fix the PR title & the top-level comment.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11029446131/job/30631870809)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11029446131/job/30631871619)

The hypotheses here can never be satisfied (unless the foundations of Mathlib are inconsistent!) since `Î²` is a `NormedAddCommGroup` and a group has to have an identity element, so it can't be empty.
Thank you, I didn't notice that, I will remove this lemma and the other one with contradictory hypotheses.

You can reuse existing type variables here to shorten the statement. If you move it to after `integral_zero_measure` then the proof telescopes to 
```lean
lemma integral_of_isEmpty [IsEmpty Î±] : âˆ« x, f x âˆ‚Î¼ = 0 := 
    Î¼.eq_zero_of_isEmpty â–¸ integral_zero_measure _
```
Are you sure tagging it as `simp` is helpful? I'm no expert in the workings of `simp`, but I doubt that this particular lemma is likely to get applied very often, and I'm nervous about the performance implications of triggering fruitless searches for `IsEmpty` instances whenever `simp` gets called on an integral.

Thank you.
I'm not sure how useful this would be as a `simp` lemma, or how much that would impact performance. For now I will remove the `simp` attribute.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat (MeasureTheory): Integrability and integral when the domain is empty.
